courses.who_for: Florida drivers with non-criminal moving violations (non-commercial license), court-ordered offenders, or voluntary attendees (max once every 12 months, 5 times lifetime).
requirements: Notify county clerk of election within 30 days of citation
Cannot have taken BDI in past 12 months or exceeded 5-lifetime limit
Court typically allows 60–90 days to finish

submission.certificate: Submit to Clerk of Court in county of ticket
submission.reporting: Providers report completions electronically to DHSMV, but driver must ensure court gets proof
submission.deadlines: Set by the court (usually 60 days from election); no state grace period

court_vs_insurance.court: Avoids points and conviction; license can be suspended if not completed/reported on time.
court_vs_insurance.insurance: Not generally used for discounts. Florida has a separate Mature Driver Course.

sources.name: Florida DHSMV – Driver Improvement Courses FAQ

courses.who_for: All first-time Florida drivers (teens or adults) before obtaining a learner’s permit or license.
requirements: Take with any Florida DMV-approved provider

submission.certificate: No paper certificate needed for DMV
submission.deadlines: Must be completed before knowledge exam; does not expire once completed

court_vs_insurance.court: Not used in court settings; strictly a licensing prerequisite.
